text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pastrami rub chicken wings you
ever been needing a pastrami sandwich
and you were thinking to yourself man
this is good but i wish you had bones in
it
well i've solved that problem we're
going to take the same spices they rub
out pastrami and use it for chicken
wings so here we go i get a couple
pounds of chicken wings they're already
prepped meaning they've been cut in half
between the flat and the drum usually
how they come these days i'm going to
add a little drizzle of vegetable oil
some white pepper lots of black pepper
that is the kind of maine pastrami spice
along with this which is ground
coriander
so coriander and black pepper are sort
of the dominant pastrami flavorings
pastrami's also smoked them not about to
smoke these wings so I'm using a little
bit of smoked paprika to give it that
little bit of you know smokiness also
adds a nice color and then a generous
sprinkling of kosher salt and then we're
going to toss that up alright once
that's coated well the last step here
just a little pinch of flour and as
these bake and as the natural oils come
out of the chicken wing skin that's
going to form a little crust on the
outside it's going to be delicious and
you know as I was tossing this I was
thinking I should have used rye flour
because these are patterned after
pastrami but you know it was too late
and I don't have any ripe flour so
whatever so anyway I'm going to toss
those on my sheet pan that I've put my
worst silicone mat those are going to go
in a hot oven 425 for 20 minutes but
they're not done this is just the
halfway point
after 20 minutes you're going to take
them out you're going to flip them over
because see all that oils coming out we
want to make sure they're evenly coated
with the oil because this last 20
minutes after you put them back in
that's when they're going to kind of
crisp up and brown nicely which is what
you see here so it's been 40 minutes all
together you can test one the bone
should pull out easily if they're done
so it might need you know 45 minutes
play by ear but for me 40 minutes at 425
was perfect you can see that beautiful
crust that formed now don't let them sit
there in the oil as soon as they come
out transfer them to your serving plate
and no blue cheese do not eat these with
blue cheese come on there pastrami wings
russian dressing or Thousand Islands
which i think is the same thing isn't it
I don't know anyway those are really
good did it taste like pastrami of
course not as they say on the farm a
chicken ain't a cow but it was good it
was interesting spicy aromatic rub and I
made a fairly decent chicken wing anyway
I hope you give that a try all the
ingredients are on the site and as
always enjoy and remember a chicken in
account
